p: All the studied Baccharis species presented secretory ducts in the mesophyll ( Figure 4e,f) and midrib of the leaves ( Figure 4g), and in the cortex of the stems ( Figure 4h,i). They showed a uniseriate epithelium formed by four to 20 cells with large nuclei and dense cytoplasm containing EO droplets, and were found next to the parenchyma sheath near the phloem ( Figure 4eâ€“i). These secretory ducts could also sometimes release other chemical compounds such as resins and tannins beside EOs [ 49]. Essential oils in the trichomes and ducts, and lipophilic compounds in the cuticle reacted positively with Sudan III in the histochemical tests ( Figure 4i).
